--- title: "Week 2: Representative Surveys" date: "January 18, 2024" format: html --- ## Overview Before jumping into public opinion, we start with an overview of the MIDA framework presented in the textbook. The MIDA framework approaches research design as a series of steps that can be encoded and, therefore, interrogated. This helps us think about how the results of a study may have changed if we had altered elements of its research design. The lab assignment for this week will be a guided introduction to R. ## Reading - {{< fa book >}} [RD sections 1-4](https://book.declaredesign.org/introduction/preface.html) ## Slides ::: {.callout-tip} ## Navigation Click on the frame below and use the arrows to navigate. You can type ? (or shift + /) to see useful commands. :::
